security: The author in numerous instances specifically discloses sources, methods, cover arrangements and liaison relationships...the confirmation of Agee's effectiveness in neutralizing Agency efforts abroad by publishing lists of CIA personnel in specific Stations; revelation 28 of Office of Communications) personnel in every Embassy abroad; the Agency role in countering terrorism, narcotics trafficking and training provided other services to counteract these activities; and, the specific identity of liaison relationships, particularly, (the Israeli 24 service.
summary: Clifton R. Strathern informs the Chief of Counterintelligence Staff that David Phillips' manuscript is undesirable from an operational and security viewpoint due to disclosures of sources, methods, cover arrangements, and liaison relationships.
summary_one_paragraph: Clifton R. Strathern, Chief of the Latin America Division, sends a memorandum to the Chief of Counterintelligence Staff, Julian Fox, expressing concerns regarding David Phillips' manuscript. Strathern notes that the manuscript reveals sensitive operational and security details, including sources, methods, cover arrangements, and liaison relationships, as well as Agency involvement in countering terrorism and narcotics. The Latin America Division has a consensus that publishing the manuscript in its current form would be detrimental to the Agency, particularly the Latin America Division.
title: General Comments on Mr. David Phillips' Manuscript
